headline: The Wrong Way—and Right Way—to Hedge This Volatile Stock Market
summary: Most investors stink at hedging—even the pros. They mostly buy puts near a stock’s current price, thinking they will make lots of money if it declines even more.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway Slashes Stake in Amazon by More Than 75%
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway slashed its stake in Amazon by more than 75% in the fourth quarter, while also building a stake in the New York Times, his last new bet as chief executive officer of the conglomerate. Bloomberg's Abeer Abu Omar reports.

content.title: Berkshire Hathaway Slashes Stake in Amazon by More Than 75%
content.description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway slashed its stake in Amazon by more than 75% in the fourth quarter, while also building a stake in the New York Times, his last new bet as chief executive officer of the conglomerate. Bloomberg's Abeer Abu Omar reports.
content.summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway slashed its stake in Amazon by more than 75% in the fourth quarter, while also building a stake in the New York Times, his last new bet as chief executive officer of the conglomerate. Bloomberg's Abeer Abu Omar reports.

headline: New York Times Stock Rallies on Berkshire Hathaway Stake-Building
summary: Shares in the New York Times rose after Berkshire Hathaway said it added a position in the media company and sold shares in Bank of America, Apple and Amazon.  Berkshire bought 5.1 million shares of the New York Times during the December quarter, Warren Buffett’s last few months as chief executive.  It sold stock in Apple, marking the third-straight period it cut its stake in the iPhone maker.

It sold stock in Apple, marking the third-straight period it cut its stake in the iPhone maker.

headline: UBS lifts forecast for big tech bond sales this year
summary: UBS lifted its 2026 forecasts for U.S. tech investment grade bond sales on Wednesday, pointing to rising spending by ‌big tech firms, while cutting its forecast for leveraged loans on expectations that ‌AI-related disruption could curb supply. Several megacap tech companies including Meta, Amazon and Alphabet have announced big increases to their ​capital expenditure plans during the latest earnings season. After years of outsized gains, big tech stocks, meanwhile, have fallen in 2026, as investors question whether heavy AI spending will generate sufficient returns to warrant lofty valuations.

content.title: UBS lifts forecast for big tech bond sales this year
content.summary: UBS lifted its 2026 forecasts for U.S. tech investment grade bond sales on Wednesday, pointing to rising spending by ‌big tech firms, while cutting its forecast for leveraged loans on expectations that ‌AI-related disruption could curb supply. Several megacap tech companies including Meta, Amazon and Alphabet have announced big increases to their ​capital expenditure plans during the latest earnings season. After years of outsized gains, big tech stocks, meanwhile, have fallen in 2026, as investors question whether heavy AI spending will generate sufficient returns to warrant lofty valuations.

thumbnail.caption: FILE PHOTO: A logo of Swiss bank UBS is seen in Zurich

headline: The Race to Build Data Centers Is Driving an 'AI Debt Boom'
summary: The data-center construction frenzy is upending expectations for U.S. corporate borrowing.  If Amazon, Meta and Google follow through on their planned investment, total spending by so-called "hyperscalers" could hit $770 billion this year, UBS said—23% higher than its previous forecast.  The bank said U.S. tech companies would continue to borrow globally, after Alphabet's recent $31.5 billion deal, which included bonds in Swiss francs and British pounds.

content.title: The Race to Build Data Centers Is Driving an 'AI Debt Boom'
content.summary: The data-center construction frenzy is upending expectations for U.S. corporate borrowing.  If Amazon, Meta and Google follow through on their planned investment, total spending by so-called "hyperscalers" could hit $770 billion this year, UBS said—23% higher than its previous forecast.  The bank said U.S. tech companies would continue to borrow globally, after Alphabet's recent $31.5 billion deal, which included bonds in Swiss francs and British pounds.

headline: Wall Street Hunts for Bottom as S&P Retests ‘Rock Solid’ Support
summary: “If it was to fail now, that would be an indication that sentiment might be shifting more bearishly,” Colin Cieszynski, chief market strategist at SIA Wealth Management Inc., said by phone.  While the S&P 500 once again held the line on Tuesday, closing up 0.1% at 6,843.22, it earlier fell to intraday low of 6,775.50.

headline: New York Times Stock Slips Despite Berkshire Hathaway Stake-Building
summary: Shares in the New York Times slipped after Berkshire Hathaway said it added a position in the media company and sold shares in Bank of America, Apple and Amazon.  Berkshire bought 5.1 million shares of the New York Times during the December quarter, Warren Buffett’s last few months as chief executive.  It sold stock in Apple, marking the third-straight period it cut its stake in the iPhone maker.

It sold stock in Apple, marking the third-straight period it cut its stake in the iPhone maker.

headline: Mark Cuban Explains How Luck Helped Turn Jeff Bezos And Mark Zuckerberg Into Billionaires — 'Something Good Has Got to Happen'
summary: Entrepreneur Mark Cuban is one of the few billionaires who doesn't pretend it was all grit and genius. He's said it repeatedly: Luck plays a key role in building massive wealth. Speaking on computer scientist Lex Fridman's podcast, Cuban said that after years in entrepreneurship, he doesn't believe any business plan can guarantee billionaire status. headline: Why Did Buffett Dump Amazon?
summary: In his final quarter as CEO of Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK-B), Warren Buffett reallocated his technology holdings.
